. As it is known that the timescale of the Li diffusion process is of the order of picoseconds, it can be analyzed by MD simulations. It can be seen from Figure 5 that the Li atoms show a larger dynamics than the Al atoms. This can be explained by the heavier mass and higher charge of Al compared to Li. Within larger time intervals, the values of MSD increase with time as observed in [ 28]. In many kinds of lithium superionic conductors, e.g., Li 3Y(PSO 4) 2, Li 5PSO 4Cl 2 [ 29], and Li 7P 3S 11 [ 30], an open site due to Li + diffusion is found to be occupied by another Li + within 10 ps.
